text: A retroviral vector ( pMIP ) was used for the stable transduction of cells with <extra_id_0> HOIP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IKKgamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cDNA constructs .
pMIP was constructed by replacing the IRES and GFP encoding sequences in pMIG [ 31 ] with the IRES and puromycin resistance gene from pIRESpuro2 ( Clontech ) .
FLAG-tagged mouse <extra_id_0> HOIP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cDNA was inserted into the multiple cloning site of pMIP .
A pMIP construct encoding mouse <extra_id_0> IKKgamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> with an amino terminal birch profilin peptide ( BP ) - tag was also prepared .

Retroviral particles were generated by transient transfection of 293T cells with pMIP , pMIP - <extra_id_0> HOIP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , or pMIP - <extra_id_0> IKKgamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the packaging vector pCL-Eco [ 32 ] .
Two days after transfection , culture supernatants were harvested and filtered .

A20.2J or <extra_id_0> HOIP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient cells were added to 24-well plates ( 2.5x105 cells / well ) with 1 ml virus-containing supernatant and 8 microg / ml polybrene .
Plates were centrifuged at 500 x g for 2 hrs at room temperature .
Cells were cultured in B cell culture medium for 48 hrs , after which the transduced cells were selected in 3 microg / ml puromycin .
